conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_B Admissions,

I’m Parent_C. I understand you are finalizing your remaining place in line with your priority order. I’d like to formally apply again and ask to be treated as an immediate, ready-to-confirm back-up in case any higher-priority family declines or does not complete confirmation.

If you are able to offer us the place at any point, we can:
- confirm acceptance the same day (immediately upon offer),
- pay any required deposit and complete all paperwork right away,
- start immediately or on any start date you require.

If it would help you close this quickly, please let me know whether you are currently awaiting a specific family’s confirmation and when you expect that decision—so I can remain available and responsive.

Thank you for your consideration.

Kind regards,
Parent_C
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_B remains unmatched and it is on my true preference list (though last). I will apply again, emphasizing immediate confirmation and asking to be contacted the moment the seat is truly available.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_C,

Thank you for staying engaged and for making your availability and readiness to confirm so clear.

On your questions about the checkpoint and a potential pivot to back-ups: while we can’t share information about specific families, the practical trigger for pivoting at our checkpoint is that we do not have a confirmed acceptance from a higher-priority family by the end of the checkpoint round (including cases of non-response or an explicit decline).

If that occurs, we would reassess immediately and contact back-up families in our priority order in the same round we make that reassessment, and we would request a same-round confirmation to finalize.

If you remain willing to be considered on that basis, please continue to monitor messages closely over the next few rounds.

Sincerely,
Nursery_B Admissions
